original: sāndrodrekakṣubhitam abhitaḥ svāntam antar niyamya prāyo dhatte navanavarasollekham ānandakandam //
analyzed: sāndra udreka kṣubhitam abhitas svāntam antar niyamya prāyas dhatte nava nava rasa ullekham ānanda kandam
translated: The inner self, agitated by intense and excessive passion, having mostly restrained itself all around, bears the root of bliss, marked with ever new and fresh sentiments.

original: bhūyo bhūyaḥ pralayavibhavoddāmaduḥkhāntarāyo yo 'sāv antar jayati hṛdaye ko 'pi saṃvidvikāsaḥ //
analyzed: bhūyas bhūyas pralaya vibhava uddāma duḥkha antarāyaḥ yaḥ sau antar jayati hṛdaye kaḥ pi saṃvid vikāsaḥ
translated: Again and again, the obstacle to the intense sorrow of dissolution and creation, that expansion of consciousness in the heart, somehow triumphs.

original: iha khalu nikhilajagadātmā sarvottīrṇaś ca sarvamayaś ca vikalpāsaṃkucitasaṃvitprakāśarūpaḥ
analyzed: iha khalu nikhila jagat ātmā sarva uttīrṇaḥ ca sarva mayaḥ ca vikalpa asaṃkucita saṃvid prakāśa rūpaḥ
translated: Here indeed, the soul of the entire world, transcendent over all and immanent in all, the light of consciousness uncontracted by conceptualization,

original: anavacchinnacidānandaviśrāntaḥ prasaradaviralavicitrapañcavāhavāhavāhinīmahodadhiḥ
translated: resting in the undivided bliss of consciousness, an ocean of the great waves of the five ever-flowing and diverse currents,

original: niratiśayasvātantryasīmani pragalbhamānaḥ sarvaśaktikhacita eka eva asti saṃvid ātmā maheśvaraḥ //
analyzed: niratiśaya svātantrya sīmani pragalbhamānaḥ sarva śakti khacitaḥ ekaḥ eva asti saṃvid ātmā maheśvaraḥ
translated: bold at the limit of supreme independence, unique, adorned with all powers, is the conscious Self, Mahesvara.

original: tasya prakāśarūpatā cicchaktiḥ svātantryam ānandaśaktiḥ taccamatkāraḥ icchāśaktiḥ āmarśātmakatā jñānaśaktiḥ sarvākārayogitvaṃ kriyāśaktiḥ iti
analyzed: tasya prakāśa rūpa tā cit śaktiḥ svātantryam ānanda śaktiḥ tad camatkāraḥ icchā śaktiḥ āmarśa ātmaka tā jñāna śaktiḥ sarva ākāra yogi tvam kriyā śaktiḥ iti
translated: His form as light is the power of consciousness, freedom is the power of bliss, wonder is the power of will, the nature of reflection is the power of knowledge, and the possession of all forms is the power of action.

original: itthaṃ sarvaśaktiyoge 'pi ābhir mukhyābhiḥ śaktibhir upacaryate sa ca bhagavān svātantryaśaktimahimnā svātmānaṃ saṃkucitam iva ābhāsayan aṇuḥ
analyzed: ittham sarva śakti yoge ābhiḥ mukhyābhiḥ śaktibhiḥ upacaryate sa ca bhagavān svātantrya śakti mahimnā sva ātmānam saṃkucitam iva ābhāsayan aṇuḥ
translated: Thus, even when united with all powers, that Lord is served by these principal powers. And that Lord, by the greatness of the power of freedom, manifesting himself as if contracted, is called an atom.

original: iti ucyate //
analyzed: iti ucyate
translated: Thus it is said.

original: yathoktam vyāpako hi śivaḥ svecchākḷptasaṃkocamudraṇāt //
analyzed: yathā uktam vyāpakaḥ hi śivaḥ sva icchā kḷpta saṃkoca mudraṇāt
translated: As it is said: Indeed, Śiva, who is all-pervading, by the sealing of contraction fashioned by his own will,

original: vicitraphalakarmaughavaśāt tattaccharīrabhāk //
analyzed: vicitra phala karma ogha vaśāt tad tad śarīra bhāj
translated: becomes the possessor of various bodies due to the power of the multitude of actions that bear various fruits.

original: iti nijasvarūpagopanakelilolam evaṃ māheśaśaktiparispandaṃ pravaraguravaḥ pratipedire //
analyzed: iti nija sva rūpa gopana keli lolam evam māheśa śakti parispandam pravara guravaḥ pratipedire
translated: Thus, the excellent teachers accepted this kind of vibration of the power of Maheśa, which is playful in the sport of concealing its own nature.

original: tathā ca āhuḥ atidurghaṭakāritvāt svācchandyanirmalād asau //
analyzed: tathā ca āhuḥ ati durghaṭa kāri tvāt svācchandya nirmalāt asau
translated: And thus they say: Due to the performance of what is extremely difficult, he, being free from the impurity of his own will,

original: svātmapracchādanakrīḍāpaṇḍitaḥ parameśvaraḥ //
translated: is the Supreme Lord, skilled in the play of concealing his own self.

original: anāvṛte svarūpe 'pi yadātmācchādanaṃ vibhoḥ //
analyzed: anāvṛte sva rūpe yat ātma ācchādanam vibhoḥ
translated: Even when his nature is uncovered, the Lord's self-concealment

original: saivāvidyā yato bheda etāvān viśvavṛttikaḥ iti //
analyzed: sā eva avidyā yatas bhedaḥ etāvān viśvavṛttikaḥ iti
translated: is indeed ignorance, from which this much of the universal activity is differentiated.🔽And by this much, there is not the slightest harm to the Lord, whose nature is the flow of unsurpassed bliss, free from the limiting adjuncts of space, time, and form. On the contrary, there is the nourishment of the highest glory.

original: na ca etāvatā bhagavato deśakālākāropādhivirahitaniratiśayānandaparisyandātmakasya kācid api kṣatiḥ pratyuta paramamahimnaḥ paripuṣṭir ity
analyzed: na ca etāvatā bhagavataḥ deśa kāla ākāra upādhi virahita niratiśaya ānanda parisyanda ātmakasya kācid api kṣatiḥ pratyuta parama mahimnaḥ paripuṣṭiḥ iti
translated: Thus,

original: asthāsyad ekarūpeṇa vapuṣā cen maheśvaraḥ //
analyzed: asthāsyat eka rūpeṇa vapuṣā ced maheśvaraḥ
translated: If Mahesvara were to remain in one form alone,

original: maheśvaratvaṃ saṃvittvaṃ tad atyakṣyad ghaṭādivat //🔽paricchinnaprakāśatvaṃ jaḍasya kila lakṣaṇam //
analyzed: maheśvara tvam saṃvid tvam tat atyakṣyat ghaṭa ādi vat  paricchinna prakāśa tvam jaḍasya kila lakṣaṇam
translated: then He would abandon His Mahesvaratva (great lordship), His consciousness, like a pot etc.🔽Limited manifestation is indeed the characteristic of the insentient.

original: jaḍād vilakṣaṇo bodho yato na parimīyate //
analyzed: jaḍāt vilakṣaṇaḥ bodhaḥ yatas na parimīyate
translated: Consciousness is different from the insentient, because it is not limited.

original: tena bodhamahāsindhor ullāsinyaḥ svaśaktayaḥ //
analyzed: tena bodha mahā sindhoḥ ullāsinyaḥ sva śaktayaḥ
translated: Therefore, the self-manifesting powers of the great ocean of consciousness

original: āśrayanty ūrmaya iva svātmasaṃghaṭṭacitratām //
analyzed: āśrayanti ūrmayaḥ iva sva ātma saṃghaṭṭa citra tām
translated: take on the wonderful unity of their own nature, like waves.

original: ityādi //
analyzed: ityādi
translated: Thus and so on.

original: tad evam asau bhagavān svamāyāśaktyākhyena avyabhicaritasvātantryaśaktimahimnā svātmanaiva ātmānaṃ saṃkucitam iva avabhāsayan vijñānākalaḥ
analyzed: tat evam asau bhagavān sva māyā śakti ākhyena avyabhicarita svātantrya śakti mahimnā sva ātmanā eva ātmānam saṃkucitam iva avabhāsayan vijñānākalaḥ  /
translated: Thus, that Lord, by the power of His own Maya called the unerring power of autonomy, manifesting Himself as if contracted by His own Self, becomes the Vijnanakala,

original: pralayākalaḥ sakalaś ca sampadyate //
analyzed: pralayākalaḥ sakalaḥ ca sampadyate
translated: the Pralayakala, and the Sakala.

original: tatra āṇavena ekenaiva malena saṃyukto vijñānākala ucyate dvābhyām āṇavamāyī yābhyām
analyzed: tatra āṇavena ekena eva malena saṃyuktaḥ vijñānākalaḥ ucyate dvābhyām āṇava māyī yābhyām
translated: There, one united with the one impurity of ignorance is called the Vijnanakala, with the two, the ignorance and Maya impurities,

original: apavedyaḥ pralayākalaḥ tribhir āṇavamāyīyakārmaiḥ saṃvedyaḥ tair eva kalādidharaṇyantatattvamayaḥ
analyzed: apavedyaḥ pralayākalaḥ tribhiḥ āṇava māyīya kārmaiḥ saṃvedyaḥ taiḥ eva kalā ādi dharaṇī anta tattva mayaḥ
translated: the Apravedya (uncognized) Pralayakala. With the three, the ignorance, Maya, and Karma impurities, the Sanvedya (cognized) Sakala, consisting of the principles from Kala to Earth,

original: sakalaḥ tadartham eva ayam arthasargaḥ //
analyzed: sakalaḥ tad artham eva ayam artha sargaḥ
translated: is for that very purpose, this creation of objects.

original: tatra sṛṣṭyunmukho bhagavān śuddhādhvani vartamānaḥ svaśaktibhiḥ māyāṃ vikṣobhya
analyzed: tatra sṛṣṭi unmukhaḥ bhagavān śuddhādhvani vartamānaḥ sva śaktibhiḥ māyām vikṣobhya
translated: There, the Lord, inclined towards creation, abiding in the pure path, agitating Maya with His own powers,

original: kalātattvaṃ kiṃcitkartṛtvalakṣaṇaṃ pudgalasya sṛjati tato 'pi kiṃcid avabodhākhyaṃ🔽vidyātattvaṃ kiṃcid abhilāṣarūpaṃ ca rāgatattvaṃ tad etat sarāgaṃ kartṛtattvaṃ bhūtabhaviṣyadvartamānatayā
analyzed: kalā tattvam kiṃcitkartṛtva lakṣaṇam pudgalasya sṛjati kiṃcid avabodha ākhyam  vidyā tattvam kiṃcid abhilāṣa rūpam ca rāga tattvam tat etat sa rāgam kartṛ tattvam bhūta bhaviṣyat vartamāna tayā
translated: creates the Kala principle, which is characterized by a little bit of agency for the individual soul. From that, He creates the Vidyā principle, which is called a little bit of understanding,🔽and the Rāga principle, which is in the form of a little bit of desire. This Rāga-accompanied agency is divided into three parts as past, future, and present.

original: tridhā avacchidyate tat kālatattvaṃ tulyatve 'pi rāge yena kartṛtvasya avacchedaḥ
analyzed: tridhā avacchidyate tat kāla tattvam tulya tve pi rāge yena kartṛ tvasya avacchedaḥ
translated: That is the Kāla principle, which, although Rāga is the same, is what divides agency.

original: kriyate tat niyatitattvaṃ tad etat kañcukaṣaṭkam antarmalāvṛtasya pudgalasya bahir
analyzed: kriyate tat niyati tattvam tat etat kañcuka ṣaṭkam antar mala āvṛtasya pudgalasya bahis
translated: That is the Niyati principle. This set of six coverings is said to be what covers the individual soul, which is enveloped by internal impurities,

original: ācchādakam uktaṃ ca cillācakreśvaramate māyā kalā śuddhavidyā rāgakālau niyantraṇā //
analyzed: ācchādakam uktam ca cillācakra īśvara mate māyā kalā śuddhavidyā rāga kālau niyantraṇā
translated: on the outside. And it is said in the Cillācakreśvara Mata: Maya, Kala, pure Vidyā, Rāga, Kāla, and Niyati,

original: ṣaḍ etāny āvṛtivaśāt kañcukāni mitātmanaḥ //
analyzed: ṣaḍ etāni āvṛti vaśāt kañcukāni mita ātmanaḥ
translated: these six are coverings due to the covering of the limited self.

original: evaṃ ca pudgalasyāntarmalaḥ kañcukavat sthitaḥ //
analyzed: evam ca pudgalasya antar malaḥ kañcuka vat sthitaḥ
translated: And thus, the internal impurity of the individual soul remains like a covering.

original: tuṣavat kañcukāni syus tasmāj jñānakriyojjhitaḥ //
analyzed: tuṣa vat kañcukāni syuḥ tasmāt jñāna kriyā ujjhitaḥ
translated: The coverings would be like husks, therefore, devoid of knowledge and action.

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: sā ca kalā puruṣasya parimitaṃ kartṛtvaṃ prakāśya sukhaduḥkhamoharūpaṃ bhogyam avyaktatvaṃ
analyzed: sā ca kalā puruṣasya parimitam kartṛ tvam prakāśya sukha duḥkha moha rūpam bhogyam avyakta tvam
translated: And that Kala, having manifested the limited agency of the Purusha, creates the unmanifest state, which is the object of enjoyment in the form of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: sṛjati tato 'pi aṣṭaguṇaṃ buddhitattvam utpannaṃ tato 'pi sāttvikarājasatāmasabhedabhinnaṃ
analyzed: sṛjati tatas pi aṣṭaguṇam buddhi tattvam utpannam tatas pi sāttvika rājasa tāmasa bheda bhinnam
translated: From that, the principle of intellect, which has eight qualities, arises. From that, the principle of egoity, which is divided into the categories of sattva, rajas, and tamas,

original: triskandham ahaṃkāratattvam tatra pūrvasmāt ahaṃkārāt mano jātam aparasmāt indriyāṇi🔽tṛtīyāt tanmātrāṇi ebhyo bhūtāni ity evam ayam ekasyaiva ādidevasya svātantryamahimnā
analyzed: tri skandham ahaṃkāra tattvam tatra pūrvasmāt ahaṃkārāt manaḥ jātam aparasmāt indriyāṇi  tṛtīyāt tanmātrāṇi ebhyaḥ bhūtāni iti evam ayam ekasya eva ādidevasya svātantrya mahimnā
translated: and which has three skandhas (aggregates), arises. From the former egoity, the mind is born, from the latter, the senses,🔽from the third, the tanmatras (subtle elements). From these, the elements. Thus, for one who wanders in the world, relying on limited subjectivity, this is the manifestation of reality, by the greatness of independence of that very primordial god.

original: saṃsāre saṃsarataḥ parimitapramātṛtām avalambamānasya tattvaprasaraḥ uktaṃ ca bhūtāni
analyzed: saṃsāre saṃsarataḥ parimita pramātṛ tām avalambamānasya tattva prasaraḥ uktam ca bhūtāni
translated: And it is said:

original: tanmātragaṇendriyāṇi mūlaṃ pumān kañcukayuk suśuddham //
analyzed: tanmātra gaṇa indriyāṇi mūlam pumān kañcuka yuj su śuddham
translated: The elements, the group of tanmatras, the senses, the purusha, and the two sheaths are pure.

original: vidyādiśaktyantam iyān svasaṃvitsindhos taraṃgaprasaraprapañcaḥ //
analyzed: vidyā ādi śakti antam iyān sva saṃvid sindhoḥ taraṃga prasara prapañcaḥ
translated: From vidya up to shakti, this is the proliferation of the waves of the ocean of one's own consciousness.

original: tathā saala utta puriṣuṇṇa u saallutta uttiṇṇa //
analyzed: tathā
translated: Thus, all the best, filled with the best, all the best, having crossed over.

original: pari āṇaha attāṇa u pari masiveṇa samāṇa u //
analyzed: pari āṇaha attāṇa u pari masiveṇa samāṇa u
translated: Having known the self, having purified oneself, having become equal.

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: eteṣāṃ ca uktarūpāṇāṃ tattvānāṃ pramātṛbhede vaicitryāt prameyavaicitryaṃ bhavati iti śrīpūrvaśāstre kathitam tathā hi śaktimacchaktibhedena
analyzed: eteṣām ca ukta rūpāṇām tattvānām pramātṛ bhede vaicitryāt prameya vaicitryam bhavati iti śrī pūrvaśāstre kathitam tathā hi śaktimat śakti bhedena
translated: And it has been said in the Sripurva Shastra that due to the diversity of the cognizers, there is diversity of the cognized in these tattvas described above. Thus:

original: dharātattvaṃ vibhidyate //
analyzed: dharā tattvam vibhidyate
translated: The earth principle is divided by the difference between the empowered and the empowerer.

original: svarūpasahitaṃ tac ca vijñeyaṃ daśapañcadhā //
analyzed: sva rūpa sahitam tat ca vijñeyam daśa pañcadhā
translated: And that, along with its own nature, should be known as fifteenfold.

original: anenaiva vidhānena puṃstattvāt tu kalāntikam //
analyzed: anena eva vidhānena puṃs tattvāt tu kalā antikam
translated: In this very way, from the male principle up to the kalas,

original: trayodaśavidhaṃ jñeyaṃ rudravat pralayākalaḥ //
analyzed: trayodaśavidham jñeyam rudra vat pralayākalaḥ
translated: The thirteenfold should be known, like Rudra, the dissolving sakala.

original: tadvan māyāpi vijñeyā navadhā jñānakevalaḥ //
analyzed: tadvat māyā api vijñeyā navadhā jñāna kevalaḥ
translated: Likewise, Maya should be known as ninefold, the knowledge-only sakala.

original: mantrāḥ saptavidhās tadvat pañcadhā mantranāyakāḥ //
analyzed: mantrāḥ saptavidhāḥ tadvat pañcadhā mantranāyakāḥ
translated: The mantras are sevenfold in the same way, the lords of mantras are fivefold.

original: tridhā mantreśvareśānāḥ śivaḥ sākṣān na bhidyate //
analyzed: tridhā mantreśvara īśānāḥ śivaḥ sākṣāt na bhidyate
translated: The lords of mantras and Ishvara are threefold, Shiva is not directly divided.

original: yaḥ punaḥ sarvatattvāni vetty etāni yathārthataḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ punar sarva tattvāni vetti etāni yathārthataḥ
translated: But he who knows all these tattvas as they are,

original: sa gurur matsamaḥ prokto mantravīryaprakāśakaḥ //
analyzed: sa guruḥ mad samaḥ proktaḥ mantra vīrya prakāśakaḥ
translated: He is said to be a guru equal to me, the revealer of the power of mantras.

original: dṛṣṭāḥ sambhāṣitās tena spṛṣṭāś ca prīticetasā //
analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ sambhāṣitāḥ tena spṛṣṭāḥ ca prīti cetasā
translated: By him, they are seen, spoken to, and touched with a loving mind,

original: narāḥ pāpaiḥ pramucyante saptajanmakṛtair api //
analyzed: narāḥ pāpaiḥ pramucyante sapta janma kṛtaiḥ api
translated: Men are freed from sins committed even in seven births.

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: tad evam anekāvasāyo 'yaṃ tattvakramaḥ //
analyzed: tat evam aneka avasāyaḥ yam tattva kramaḥ
translated: Thus, this sequence of principles is of many kinds.

original: eteṣāṃ ca tattvānāṃ vargaśo yad anugāmi rūpam ekarūpam ekarūpakalanāsahiṣṇutvāt sā kalā kathyate //
analyzed: eteṣām ca tattvānām vargaśas yat anugāmi rūpam eka rūpam eka rūpa kalanā sahiṣṇu tvāt sā kalā kathyate
translated: And the form that is common to these principles when grouped together is called kalā, because it can bear the idea of a single form.

original: tathā hi nivartante yatas tattvavargāḥ sā nivṛttir nāma kalā //
analyzed: tathā hi nivartante yatas tattva vargāḥ sā nivṛttiḥ nāma kalā
translated: Thus, that from which the groups of principles turn back is called the kalā Nivṛtti.

original: sā ca pṛthivyām eva vyavasthitā //
analyzed: sā ca pṛthivyām eva vyavasthitā
translated: And that is established only in the earth.

original: kāraṇatve pūraṇāpyāyakāritvāt pratiṣṭhā nāma kalā ucyate //
analyzed: kāraṇa tve pūraṇa āpyāya kāri tvāt pratiṣṭhā nāma kalā ucyate
translated: Because it causes the filling and nourishing in the state of being a cause, it is called the kalā called Pratiṣṭhā.

original: sā ca jalādimūlāntaṃ vyāpya vyavasthitā //
analyzed: sā ca jala ādi mūla antam vyāpya vyavasthitā
translated: And that extends and is established from water up to the end of the root.

original: vedyavilaye saṃvidādhikyāt vidyā nāma kalā //
analyzed: vedya vilaye saṃvid ādhikyāt vidyā nāma kalā
translated: Because of the predominance of consciousness in the dissolution of the knowable, it is called the kalā called Vidyā.

original: sā ca pumādimāyāntam adhvānam adhyāste //
analyzed: sā ca pum ādi māyā antam adhvānam adhyāste
translated: And that occupies the path from the individual soul up to Māyā.

original: kañcukataraṃgopaśamāt śāntā nāma kalā ucyate //
analyzed: kañcuka taraṃga upaśamāt śāntā nāma kalā ucyate
translated: Because of the pacification of the waves of the coverings, it is called the kalā called Śāntā.

original: sā ca śuddhavidyādiśaktyante sthitā iti //
analyzed: sā ca śuddhavidyā ādi śakti ante sthitā iti
translated: And that is established from pure knowledge up to Śakti.

original: etad eva aṇḍacatuṣṭayaṃ pārthivaprākṛtamāyīyaśāktalakṣaṇam //
analyzed: etat eva aṇḍa catuṣṭayam pārthiva prākṛta māyīya śākta lakṣaṇam
translated: This very set of four eggs is characterized by the earth, Prakṛti, Māyā, and Śakti.

original: sarvātītatvāt śivatattve śāntyatītā //
analyzed: sarva atīta tvāt śivatattve śānti atītā
translated: Because it is beyond all, it is Śāntyatīta in the Śiva principle.

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: paraṃ tu tattvaṃ svatantratvāt kalātītam āsām eva kalānāṃ tattvavad antarbhūtāni
analyzed: param tu tattvam svatantra tvāt kalā atītam āsām eva kalānām tattva vat antarbhūtāni
translated: But the supreme principle, being independent, is beyond the kalās. The kalās themselves are included within it, like the principles.

original: bhuvanāny api boddhavyāni evaṃ sthūlasūkṣmaparatvena bhuvanatattvakalārūpaṃ trividharūpaṃ
analyzed: bhuvanāni api boddhavyāni evam sthūla sūkṣma para tvena bhuvana tattva kalā rūpam trividha rūpam
translated: The worlds should also be understood in the same way, as threefold in the form of worlds, principles, and parts, through grossness, subtlety, and supremacy.

original: prameyam uktam pramāṇam api tathaiva padamantravarṇatayā trividham eva iti ekasyaiva🔽pūrṇapramātuḥ svātantryāt saṃsarataḥ ṣaḍvidhe adhvani viśrāntir uktā //

analyzed: ayuktam imam ācāram tyajet vai na aurdhvadaihikam

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: śrī matarahasyatilake pi uttama naya adhikāriṇām saṃvṛta nija sat ācārāṇām loka prasiddhi rakṣāyai tad ācāra aparityāgaḥ āmnātaḥ tathā hi loka ācārasya
translated: And in the Shrimat Rahasyatilaka also, for the protection of the well-known conduct of the world, the abandonment of that conduct is mentioned even for those who are entitled to the best way and who have concealed their own good conduct. Thus, the conduct of the world,

analyzed: vicchedaḥ na kartavyaḥ kadācana

translated: And it is said that after propitiating the guru, the sacrifice, japa, homa, fasting, etc. should be performed necessarily with the guru in mind, as stated in the venerable Mahākula: In the thread-less, part-lost, endowed with desired dust,

analyzed: api mantram an āhūya maṇḍale vidhi codite  /

analyzed: saṃnidhānam prakurvanti mantrāṇām sapta koṭayaḥ

analyzed: kim punar kaulika āmnāyaḥ tatra āhūya prapūjitaḥ
translated: What then of the Kaula tradition, invited and worshipped there?

analyzed: samuddiśya pitṝn bhadre tat ānantyāya kalpate
translated: When the ancestors are invoked, O good lady, then it becomes endless.

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: śrī pracaṇḍabhairave pi uktam tanu vittāḥ ca ye martyāḥ guru mantra parāyaṇāḥ
translated: And it is said in the venerable Pracaṇḍabhairava: Those mortals who are devoted to the guru and mantra,

analyzed: viśeṣeṇa mahā yāga pūjanam prati na kṣamāḥ

analyzed: siddha liṅgam tadā teṣām pitṛ artham pūjayet budhaḥ

analyzed: ucitam pūjanam tatra devānām api durlabham
translated: The worship there is proper, difficult to obtain even for the gods.

original: kulāny uddharate tatra daśa pūrvāparāṇy api //
analyzed: kulāni uddharate tatra daśa pūrva aparāṇi api
translated: There, one elevates ten generations of ancestors and descendants.

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: śrī bhāgeśamate viṣa sarpa agni apasmāra kṣudhā atyaśana bandhanaiḥ
translated: In the view of the venerable Bhagesa, by poison, snake, fire, epilepsy, hunger, overeating, and bondage,

analyzed: brāhmaṇa mleccha pāṣaṇḍi nirmūla uḍḍāmara kramaiḥ  ye hatāḥ pāpa karmāṇaḥ mitra droha ratāḥ ca ye
translated: By the rootless, unrestrained sequence of Brahmins, barbarians, and heretics,🔽Those who are killed, those who commit sinful acts, those who delight in betraying friends,

original: svāmidrohakṛtāś cānye ye tathātmopaghātakāḥ //
analyzed: svāmi droha kṛtāḥ ca anye ye tathā ātma upaghātakāḥ
translated: Others who commit treason, and those who harm themselves,

analyzed: gurviṇyaḥ duścaritrāḥ ca prasavena hatāḥ ca yāḥ
translated: Pregnant women of bad conduct, and those who are killed in childbirth,

original: teṣām uddharaṇopāyo nānyo 'sti varavarṇini //
analyzed: teṣām uddharaṇa upāyaḥ varavarṇini
translated: There is no other means of liberation for them, O best of women,

original: vinā yāgaṃ vinā homaṃ vinā mūrtiparigraham //
analyzed: vinā yāgam vinā homam vinā mūrti parigraham
translated: Without sacrifice, without oblation, without assuming a form,

analyzed: vinā mahā jāla vidhi prayoga āhṛta pudgalam
translated: Without the application of the great net method of attracting individuals,

analyzed: mṛtoddharaṇa saṃjñām ca dīkṣām sarva adhva vartinīm iti
translated: The initiation called liberating the dead, which is present in all paths.

analyzed: tat ayam tāvat ūrdhva śāsana vartinām kramaḥ
translated: This, then, is the sequence for those who follow the higher teachings.

original: itareṣāṃ tu svaśāstrasamayopanyastānuṣṭhānam eva śreyaḥ tad alam anena //
analyzed: itareṣām tu sva śāstra samaya upanyasta anuṣṭhānam eva śreyaḥ tat alam anena
translated: But for others, the performance of duties laid down in their own scriptures is indeed the highest good. Enough of this.

original: evaṃ samanantarodīritayā nītyā janmamaraṇaprabandhasambandham avadhārya akṛtrimasvarūpaparāmarśanena jīvanmuktim āsādya kṛtakṛtyatām ālambante

translated: Thus, having understood the connection of the series of birth and death according to the principle stated just now, and having attained liberation while living by the reflection on the natural, unfabricated nature,

original: santaḥ //
analyzed: santaḥ
translated: the good people attain the state of having done what was to be done.

analyzed: amṛtam iti nigīrṇe kālakūṭe devāḥ yadi pibata tadānīm niścitam vaḥ śiva tvam

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: śrīmadyogeśvarācāryaprasādāsāditasthitiḥ //
translated: The state attained by the grace of the illustrious Yogeshvara Acharya,

translated: Vamadeva composed this inquiry into birth and death.🔽The women, slow due to the intoxication of new wine, and the sweet arrangements of songs in the spring season,

analyzed: bata bata hṛdayam haranti vācaḥ lalita padāḥ ca rahasya vastu garbhāḥ
translated: oh! oh! indeed captivate the heart with their words having charming words and filled with secret matters.

analyzed: kṛtiḥ tatrabhavat mahā māheśvara ācārya varya śrīmat bhaṭṭa vāmadevasya
translated: This is the work of the illustrious Bhatta Vamadeva, the foremost among the great Mahesvara Acharyas.

original: sadvidyānāṃ saṃśraye granthavidvadvyūhe hrāsaṃ kālavṛttyopayāte //🔽tattatsaddharmoddidhīrṣaikatānasatprekṣaujaḥśālinā karmavṛttyai //

translated: When the time has come for the decline of the array of learned men in the abode of true knowledge,

analyzed: śrīmat kaśmīra adhirājena mukhyaiḥ dharma udyuktaiḥ mantribhiḥ svaiḥ vivecya
translated: By the glorious king of Kashmir and his chief ministers devoted to Dharma, after careful examination,

analyzed: pratyaṣṭhāpi jñāna vijñāna garbha grantha uddhṛtyai mukhya kārya ālayaḥ yaḥ
translated: The main office was established for the purpose of extracting texts filled with knowledge and wisdom.

analyzed: pūrtyā śuddhyā vyākhyayā saṃskṛtaḥ stād pūrṇaḥ granthaḥ śreyase sat janānām

original: tilakam //
analyzed: tilakam
